description: 1845, US, Ohio, from blow (“speak idly, boast”) + -i-  +‎ -ate, by analogy with deviate.

verbs.description: bloviate (third-person singular simple present bloviates, present participle bloviating, simple past and past participle bloviated)

entries.meaning: (intransitive, US) To speak or discourse at length in a pompous or boastful manner.
